TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {300489=Contributed By: GhostWolf1971., 139049=* -35 AC bonus * Counts as a +10 weapon * THAC0: +50 * Damage: 1d10+1000, +1500 fire, +1500 magic, +1500 cold, +1000 piercing, +1000 slashing, and an additional 1000 of undisclosed damage * 8 attacks per turn (if you get more proficiencies, you'll get a max of 10 attacks per turn) * 100% magic resistance * Immunity to: charm, panic, sleep, slow, stun, fatigue, hold, confusion, feeblemindedness, web, and some others * There are no race, class, or alignment restrictions on it, so everyone can use it, 319025=© 2015 CBS Interactive Inc. textBeforeTable: First, write this in the console: CLUAConsole:EnableCheatKeys() Use CTRL+6 to view the previous paper doll and CTRL+7 to view the next one. textAfterTable: change paper doll armor type Ctrl+1 change to next paper doll Ctrl+7 change to previous paper doll Ctrl+6 darken screen Ctrl+2 debug dump Ctrl+D First enter CLUAConsole:EnableCheatKeys() in the console via Ctrl+Tab Enable cheat keys got to next chapter Ctrl+C heals character under cursor Ctrl+R jump to space under cursor Ctrl+J kills character under cursor Ctrl+Y lighten screen Ctrl+3 select a sprite animation Ctrl+S show interactable Ctrl+4 shows coordinates under cursor Ctrl+L shows last FMV clip Ctrl+B shows position info Ctrl+X shows sprites Ctrl+9 shows text boxes Ctrl+8 turns to character Ctrl+F Contributed By: Fenriswolf. 0 0 Get Mage Items When in the game (and have edited your baldur.ini file) press [Ctrl] + [Tab] and type in CLUAConsole:CreateItem('xxx') where xxx is one of the following: Effect Code Barkskin Ring MAGE02 Blur Ring MAGE04 Mirror Image Ring MAGE03 Ring of Free Action MAGE05 Ring of Free Action MAGE06 Ring of Invisibility MAGE01
